summaryText: What an incredible sermon on faith by Pastors Darrison and Whitney Tellez! Today's message, centered on the story of Abraham and Isaac, was a powerful exploration of radical faith and obedience. Using the biblical narrative of Abraham being asked by God to sacrifice his son Isaac, the pastors painted a vivid picture of what true faith looks like - trusting God even when the path doesn't make sense. Isn't that just like our walk with God? Sometimes He asks us to do things that seem impossible, illogical, or even painful. But the key takeaway is that God isn't trying to hurt us; He's trying to build our faith and reveal His incredible provision. The story beautifully illustrates that when we're willing to give back to God what He's given us, He can do exceedingly, abundantly more than we could ever imagine. The pastors shared personal stories that made the message incredibly relatable - like the story of hiking a mountain and not giving up, or their journey with family challenges. The bottom line? Keep climbing, because the Lord will provide. Whether you're facing a mountain in your marriage, your career, or your personal life, God is saying, 'Just keep climbing, because I've got you.'
mainPoints: Faith is matured through movement and obedience
God's destination is often the journey itself
True faith means trusting God even when the path seems unclear

versesMentioned.text: Sometime later God tested Abraham. He said to him, 'Abraham!' 'Here I am,' he replied. Then God said, 'Take your son, your only son, whom you love—Isaac—and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.'
The Lord makes firm the steps of the one who delights in him;
Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

Monday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing areas where you need to trust God more
Monday.action: Make a list of current challenges. Beside each one, write how you might be trying to control the situation instead of trusting God. Surrender these areas to Him in prayer.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me to trust You completely. Show me where I'm holding onto control and give me the courage to let go and trust Your plan. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Hebrews 11:6: 'And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding what true faith looks like
Tuesday.action: Identify one area in your life where you're struggling to have faith. Journal about what specific steps you can take to trust God more in this situation.
Tuesday.prayer: God, increase my faith. Help me to believe not just in Your existence, but in Your active involvement in my life. Give me courage to trust You more deeply. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Isaiah 40:31: 'But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.'
Wednesday.action: Find a quiet place and spend time reflecting on past moments where God has been faithful. Write down these testimonies as a reminder of His provision.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, remind me of Your faithfulness. Help me to remember Your past provisions and trust You for my future. Renew my strength today. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 1 Peter 1:6-7: 'In all this you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while you may have had to suffer grief in all kinds of trials. These have come so that the proven genuineness of your faith—of greater worth than gold, which perishes even though refined by fire—may result in praise, glory and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.'
Thursday.action: Reach out to someone who is going through a difficult season. Offer encouragement and pray with them, sharing how God uses trials to strengthen our faith.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me to see trials as opportunities for growth. Give me compassion for others who are struggling and wisdom to support them. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:7: 'For we live by faith, not by sight.'
Friday.focus: Learning to walk by faith, not by feelings
Friday.action: Make a conscious effort today to make decisions based on what you know about God's character, not on your current emotions or circumstances.
Friday.prayer: God, help me to fix my eyes on You, not on my changing circumstances. Give me spiritual eyes to see beyond what is visible. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal any areas where you need to surrender and trust His plan more completely.
Saturday.prayer: Father, I trust that You are working all things together for my good. Help me to release my grip on control and fully trust Your plan. Amen.
